importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Daniel Naroditsky won the under-12 World Youth Chess Championship in 2007, establishing himself as a top young talent in international chess.
Naroditsky graduated from Stanford University with a bachelor’s degree in history in 2019, marking a significant milestone in his academic and professional journey.
The New York Times hired Naroditsky as a chess columnist in 2022, highlighting his growing influence in mainstream media and chess journalism.
The 2025 US Chess Championship began on October 21, 2025, with a moment of silence for Daniel Naroditsky, underscoring his lasting impact on the chess world.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Naroditsky’s career spanned from his early youth achievements in 2007 through his death in 2025, showcasing a long and impactful journey in chess from youth to professional and educational influence.

keyTakeAways: Daniel Naroditsky, an American chess grandmaster, died at the age of 29.
He was born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area and began playing chess at age 6.
He earned the grandmaster title before high school, won multiple national championships, and became the youngest California K-12 champion at age 10.
In 2007, he became the under-12 World Youth Chess Champion, gaining international acclaim.
Naroditsky graduated from Stanford University with a degree in history in 2019.
He authored a chess manual at age 14 and became a regular contributor to Chess Life and a chess columnist for The New York Times.
He built massive online audiences on YouTube (nearly 500,000 subscribers) and Twitch (340,000 followers), livestreaming games and teaching accessible chess strategies.
The Charlotte Chess Center, where he served as head coach, confirmed his death and praised his role as a player, commentator, and educator.
The International Chess Federation and Saint Louis Chess Club expressed deep mourning, calling him a 'beloved pillar of the chess community'.
The 2025 US Chess Championship began with a moment of silence in his honor, reflecting his widespread influence.
His family has requested privacy and asked the public to remember him for his passion and inspiration to others.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Daniel Naroditsky, an American chess grandmaster born in the San Francisco Bay Area, died at age 29. A prodigy who earned the grandmaster title before high school and won the under-12 World Youth Chess Championship in 2007, he went on to become a prominent educator, commentator, and media personality. He graduated from Stanford University in 2019 and gained a massive online following through his YouTube and Twitch channels, where he livestreamed games and made chess accessible. Recognized by the International Chess Federation, The New York Times, and the Saint Louis Chess Club, Naroditsky was a beloved figure in the global chess community. His death prompted a moment of silence during the 2025 US Chess Championship and widespread mourning from chess organizations and fans, underscoring his lasting influence on both the game and its public engagement.
title: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky dies at 29
